intro: Dichapetalum guineense, commonly known as the African candlewood, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rhizophoraceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces woody fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland forest areas. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
